geninfo.para: The radiator in the 7000 series chassis is mounted above the frame rail to allow for increased ground clearance and for the accessibility of front mounted options, without interfering with the cooling system components.

The 7000 series procedures vary based on the build date of the specific chassis. Refer to the S09007 service manual for the specific information on build dates and hood and component removal procedures.

note.para: It is also possible to remove the radiator assembly in the 7000 Series Models without removing the hood assembly. If this approach is used, heed the following WARNING.

warning.para: To prevent vehicle damage and/or personal injury, use care when removing or installing cooling system components with the hood in the open position. With the hood assembly in the open position, the available space to maneuver components such as the charge air cooler, air conditioning condenser, external transmission cooler (if applicable) and radiator frame and core assembly is limited, making handling of the components difficult.

geninfo.para: The new International Severe Service truck line has initiated a new high life cycle, low maintenance cooling system, with vehicle down time anticipation at an industry low. The design eliminates long periods of down time waiting for radiator cooling component repair.

warning.para: To prevent vehicle damage, personal injury, or possible death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface. Make sure the engine ignition is in the off position, and the transmission is in neutral or in the park position if the vehicle is equipped with an automatic transmission. Set the parking brake, chock the wheels, and disconnect the batteries at the negative terminal before doing any service procedures on the engine or vehicle.

caution.para: Protect all open ports in the charge air system during removal and installation. Dirt or foreign particles in charge air cooling piping or cooling system components could cause internal damage to engine parts.

note.para: The grille assembly must be removed prior to radiator removal. Refer to S09007, HOOD, FENDER AND GRILLE for removal. Hood removal and cooling system components will all be removed utilizing the procedures as outlined in the 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600 and 7700 series chassis section.
